SEARCH
Package bn.parser

Class XMLBIFParser

java.lang.Object
bn.parser.XMLBIFParser
public class XMLBIFParser extends Object
DocumentBuilder-based DOM parser for XMLBIF files.

Note that XMLBIF explicitly states that There is no mandatory order of variable and probability blocks. This means that we have to read the DOM, then create nodes for all the variables using the variable elements, then hook them up and add the CPTs using the definition blocks. A good reason to use a DOM parser rather than a SAX parser.

Also XMLBIF appears to use uppercase tag names, perhaps thinking they really ought to be case-insensitive.

I have implemented minimal sanity checking and error handling. You could do better. Caveat codor.

    protected void
    recursivelyInitCPT(CPT cpt, Assignment a, List<RandomVariable> givens, StringTokenizer tokens)
    Recursively initialize the given CPT as follows: If the list of givens (parents) is empty: Then use the given ArrayMapAssignment (of values to parents) for the ``row'' of the CPT For each value of the CPT's variable, read a token, parse it as a double, and set that as the probability for the value in the row Note that this will handle the priors for variables with no parents since the first call to this method passes an empty ArrayMapAssignment. Otherwise: Remove the first variable from the list of givens (parents) For each value of that variable, add the variable=value assignment to the ArrayMapAssignment and recurse on the rest of the givens.

    • initCPTFromString

      public void initCPTFromString(CPT cpt, List<RandomVariable> givens, String str) throws NumberFormatException, CPTFormatException
      Reads numeric values from the given string, and saves them as the probability values of entries in the given CPT.

      XMLBIF spec: ``The body of the TABLE tag is a sequence of non-negative real numbers, in the counting order of the declared variables, taking the GIVEN variables first and then the FOR variables.''

      Example: P(A|B,C) where A has 3 values, B has 2 values and C has 4 values 

                      p(A1|B1 C1) 
                p(A2|B1 C1) 
                p(A3|B1 C1) 
                p(A1|B1 C2) 
                p(A2|B1 C2) 
                p(A3|B1 C2) 
                p(A1|B1 C3) 
                p(A2|B1 C3) 
                p(A3|B1 C3) 
                p(A1|B1 C4) 
                p(A2|B1 C4) 
                p(A3|B1 C4) 
                p(A1|B2 C1) 
                p(A2|B2 C1) 
                p(A3|B2 C1) 
                p(A1|B2 C2) 
                p(A2|B2 C2) 
                p(A3|B2 C2) 
                p(A1|B2 C3) 
                p(A2|B2 C3) 
                p(A3|B2 C3) 
                p(A1|B2 C4) 
                p(A2|B2 C4) 
                p(A3|B2 C4)
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException
      CPTFormatException

    • recursivelyInitCPT

      protected void recursivelyInitCPT(CPT cpt, Assignment a, List<RandomVariable> givens, StringTokenizer tokens)
      Recursively initialize the given CPT as follows:
      1. If the list of givens (parents) is empty:
        • Then use the given ArrayMapAssignment (of values to parents) for the ``row'' of the CPT
        • For each value of the CPT's variable, read a token, parse it as a double, and set that as the probability for the value in the row
        • Note that this will handle the priors for variables with no parents since the first call to this method passes an empty ArrayMapAssignment.
      2. Otherwise:
        • Remove the first variable from the list of givens (parents)
        • For each value of that variable, add the variable=value assignment to the ArrayMapAssignment and recurse on the rest of the givens.

    • getChildWithTagName

      protected Element getChildWithTagName(Element elt, String tagname)

    • getChildText

      public String getChildText(Node node)
      Returns the concatenated child text of the specified node. This method only looks at the immediate children of type Node.TEXT_NODE or the children of any child node that is of type Node.CDATA_SECTION_NODE for the concatenation.

    • trace

      protected void trace(String msg)

    • main

      public static void main(String[] argv) throws IOException, ParserConfigurationException, SAXException
      Parse an XMLBIF file and print out the resulting BayesianNetwork.

      Usage: java bn.parser.XMLBIFParser FILE

      With no arguments: reads aima-alarm.xml in the src tree

      Throws:
      IOException
      ParserConfigurationException
      SAXException
